title: THE TENANT
author: Freida McFadden
description: Things take an unsettling turn when a marketing executive loses his job and a woman rents a room in his brownstone.

title: ONE GOLDEN SUMMER
author: Carley Fortune
description: A photographer returns to a place where she spent a summer as a teenager and runs into the guy she had a crush on back then.

title: GREAT BIG BEAUTIFUL LIFE
author: Emily Henry
description: A writer looking for her big break competes against a Pulitzer winner to tell the story of an octogenarian with a storied past.

title: SHIELD OF SPARROWS
author: Devney Perry
description: A princess deals with various adversaries as she moves into the role she chooses for herself, not the one chosen for her.

title: MY FRIENDS
author: Fredrik Backman
description: A young woman looks into the story behind a painting that was made 25 years ago and a small group of teens depicted in it; translated by Neil Smith.

title: BIG DUMB EYES
author: Nate Bargatze
description: The Grammy Award-nominated comedian shares snippets from his life and career.

title: MATRIARCH
author: Tina Knowles with Kevin Carr O'Leary
description: The businesswoman, who is the mother of Beyoncé Knowles-Carter and Solange Knowles, traces her life’s journey.

title: TINA
author: Niall Harbison
description: The story of a golden retriever who was rescued in Thailand and became the inspiration for a dog hospital that was named after her.

title: MY NEXT BREATH
author: Jeremy Renner
description: The Academy Award-nominated actor tells the story of the accident he had with a snowplow and his efforts to recover from it.

title: THE ANXIOUS GENERATION
author: Jonathan Haidt
description: A co-author of “The Coddling of the American Mind” looks at the mental health impacts that a phone-based life has on children.

title: WE CAN DO HARD THINGS
author: Glennon Doyle, AbWambach and Amanda Doyle

title: WONDER
author: R.J. Palacio
description: A boy with a facial deformity starts school. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: THE GATE, THE GIRL, AND THE DRAGON
author: Grace Lin
description: Three unlikely characters join forces to retrieve the lost Sacred Sphere. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: IMPOSSIBLE CREATURES
author: Katherine Rundell. Illustrated Ashley Mackenzie
description: A young boy is enlisted to save a place where magical creatures reside. (Ages 10 and up)

title: J VS. K
author: Kwame Alexander and Jerry Craft
description: An intense rivalry ensues when two talented fifth graders vie for Dean Ashley Public School’s annual creative storytelling competition. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: A HERO'S GUIDE TO SUMMER VACATION
author: Pablo Cartaya
description: A famous author's grandson tags along for his last book tour. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: WHY A DAUGHTER NEEDS A MOM
author: Gregory E. Lang. Illustrated Sydney Hanson
description: The special bond between mother and daughter. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: I LOVE MOM WITH THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR
author: Eric Carle
description: That ravenous insect is brimming with motherly love. (Ages 3 to 5)

title: BECAUSE I HAD A TEACHER
author: Kobi Yamada. Illustrated Natalie Russell
description: An ode to teachers. (Ages 4 to 7)

title: WHY A SON NEEDS A MOM
author: Gregory E. Lang. Illustrated Gail Yerrill
description: The special bond between mother and son. (Ages 4 to 7)

title: WILL THE PIGEON GRADUATE?
author: Mo Willems
description: The Pigeon questions his academic future. (Ages 3 to 5)

title: THE HUNGER GAMES
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a dystopia, a girl fights for survival on live TV. (Ages 12 and up)

title: THE POWERLESS TRILOGY
author: Lauren Roberts
description: A story of forbidden love between Paedyn, an Ordinary, and Kai, an Elite, in the kingdom of Ilya. (Ages 14 and up)

title: THE WILD ROBOT
author: Peter Brown
description: Roz the robot adapts to her surroundings on a remote, wild island. (Ages 7 to 12)

title: THE SUMMER I TURNED PRETTY TRILOGY
author: Jenny Han
description: A beach house, summer love and enduring friendships. (Ages 12 and up)

title: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID
author: written and illustrated Jeff Kinney
description: The travails and challenges of adolescence. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: WATCH ME
author: Tahereh Mafi
description: After 10 years, the Reestablishment looks to make a move on the New Republic of the West. (Ages 14 and up)

title: HEARTLESS HUNTER
author: Kristen Ciccarelli
description: Rune, a witch, and Gideon, a witch-hunter, fall in love. (Ages 13 to 18)

title: REBEL WITCH
author: Kristen Ciccarelli
description: Rune and Gideon must join forces to stop a sinister plot by Cressida Roseblood. (Ages 13 to 18)

title: WINGS OF STARLIGHT
author: Allison Saft
description: Clarion, the successor to the throne of Pixie Hollow, is determined to confront a monster that threatens the land. (Ages 12 to 18)

title: HIS FACE IS THE SUN
author: Michelle Jabès Corpora
description: In the kingdom of Khetara, a prophecy brings together four teens from different walks of life. (Ages 14 to 18)
